newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Port Arthur gunman left trail of carnage.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Port Arthur gunman left trail of carnage.

text.p: Australia's worst shooting massacre in modern history began on a crisp, sunny, autumn Sunday in April on the tranquil island state of Tasmania. Within 24 hours, 35 people were dead and a whole nation was in mourning.
According to survivors of the massacre at the historic former penal colony of Port Arthur, a lone gunman simply went beserk after quietly finishing his lunch.
Shortly after 1.30 p.m. on April 28 the gunman walked inside the Broad Arrow Cafe and starting shooting, they say.
Minutes later 20 people were dead, some where they had sat eating their lunch.
Survivors told a terrifying story of a man who reached inside his tennis bag, pulled out a semi-automatic rifle and began shooting indiscriminately.
Those who pleaded for mercy attracted the gunman's attention and his deadly wrath, survivors said.

Outside the cafe, the tourists continued sightseeing or picnics unaware of the carnage. Many said they thought the gunshots were part of a stunt or a convict re-enactment and some even hurried towards the cafe to see the attraction.
As the gunman left the cafe, he began shooting at cars and buses and fleeing tourists. Witnesses said the gunman seemed relaxed and focused as he shot.
After killing five more people, including a tour bus driver, the gunman drove off, but stopped a short distance later.
Nanette Mikac was fleeing, carrying her three-year-old daughter Madeline in her arms, and her six-year-old daughter Alannah.
The gunman shot and killed Mikac and Madeline. Alannah ran into the bushes and crouched behind a gum tree. The gunman stalked her to her hiding place and shot her.
Within an hour the death toll was 32.
The gunman then took three people hostage and drove to a nearby guest house where he kept police at bay until Monday morning when the cottage burnt down.
The charred remains of the three hostages in the rubble of stone and twisted metal brought the death toll to 35.
